components.description: A roller coaster in a theme park going down a dip in the ride. Three carriages can be seen with two people in each red carriage.
components.title: Roller Coaster

description: A roller coaster in a theme park going down a dip in the ride. Three carriages can be seen with two people in each red carriage.
title: Roller Coaster

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Entertainment symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A roller coaster in a theme park going down a dip in the ride. Three carriages can be seen with two people in each red carriage. Roller Coas http://emojipedia.org/roller-coaster/
emoji_net_data.name: roller coaster

bn:00010313n: Elevated railway in an amusement park (usually with sharp curves and steep inclines)
The roller coaster is an amusement ride developed for amusement parks and modern theme parks.
An amusement ride consisting of a buggy on a track that rises, falls, twists and turns.
An amusement ride consisting of a buggy on a track that rises and falls and twists and turns.

bn:00016139n: Festive season which occurs immediately before Lent
A festive season which occurs immediately before Lent.
A festival marked by merrymaking and processions
Carnival is a festive season which occurs immediately before Lent; the main events are usually during February.
A festive occasion marked by parades and sometimes special foods and other entertainment.

bn:00062952n: A playground, playpark, or play area is a place with a specific design to allow children to play there.
Yard consisting of an outdoor area for children's play
Place with a specific design for children to be able to play there
A piece of land used for recreation, especially by children, often including equipment such as swings and slides.
Small area with dedicated play equipment, usually for children

bn:00003695n: An amusement park that is designed to carry a theme in one or more areas of the park.
A group of entertainment attractions, rides, and other events in a location for the enjoyment of large numbers of people
An open-air entertainment area consisting of stalls, side shows etc.
An amusement park or theme park is a group of entertainment attractions, rides, and other events in a location for the enjoyment of large numbers of people.
Amusement park that has one or more specific central themes.
An amusement park that has one or more specific central themes, often as part of its name
A commercially-operated collection of rides, games and other entertainment attractions.
A commercially operated park with stalls and shows for amusement

bn:03199948n: A toy train is a toy that represents a train.
